articles.title: PAGE 1 ===
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers held a meeting on January 22, 1968, where they discussed upcoming events and made decisions about the club. The February meeting will feature a film, a talk on satellite weather pictures, and a progress report on a telescope project.

articles.title: PAGE 2 ===
articles.summary: The S.J.A.A. Board of Directors met on February 19, 1968, to discuss various club matters, including the lack of a bill for a film shown at the last meeting and the cancellation of two star parties due to bad weather.

articles.title: PAGE 3 ===
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomer's Club is hosting a meeting at the Leininger Community Center to show the movie 'The Invisible Planet' and feature a presentation by Greg Toben on receiving weather satellite pictures.

articles.title: PAGE 4 ===
articles.summary: The S.J.A.A. Board of Directors met on March 15, 1968, to discuss upcoming events and proposals, including a publicized observing session for the April 12 moon eclipse and plans for fund-raising through photo-murals from Sky Sets.

articles.title: PAGE 5 ===
articles.summary: The April meeting of S.J.A.A. will feature a talk by Mr. Lewis Haugney on an airborne aurora expedition in Canada, and the program for the May meeting will be a review of the April 12 moon eclipse with members' photographs.

articles.title: PAGE 6 ===
articles.summary: The S.J.A.A. Board of Directors met on May 17, 1968 to discuss proposed amendments, nominations for the Nominating Committee, and upcoming events such as star parties and the Annual Banquet.

articles.title: PAGE 7 ===
articles.summary: The article presents a proposed amendment to the bylaws of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers (SJAA) regarding club dues and membership subscriptions. The proposal aims to implement a fiscal year system, with quarterly payment deadlines for dues and magazine subscriptions.

articles.title: PAGE 8 ===
articles.summary: The S.J.A.A. held its June business meeting, where new board members were elected and positions assigned. A star party was planned for July 27 at Fremont Peak State Park. The meeting also discussed the production of the Bulletin.

articles.title: PAGE 9 ===
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers are requesting Dr. John G. Phillips to deliver the Morrison Lecture at their Annual Banquet on July 13, 1968. The society had a positive response to his previous lecture and wants him to speak again.

articles.title: PAGE 10 ===
articles.summary: A letter from the University of California, Berkeley Astronomy Department to a San Jose Amateur Astronomers member requesting information about their Morrison Lecture and discussing arrangements for the event.

articles.title: PAGE 11 ===
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers cancel the Morrison Lecture for their Annual Banquet, instead opting for a local speaker. The decision is made in cooperation with Dr. Whitford and is seen as a private event for members. A possibility exists that a Morrison Lecture may be requested for a future regular meeting.

articles.title: PAGE 12 ===
articles.summary: Newell Trask of the U.S. Geological Survey has agreed to give a talk at an upcoming banquet.

articles.title: PAGE 13 ===
articles.summary: A planning meeting for the SJAA (San Jose Astronomy Association) was held on July 15, 1968. Decisions were made regarding future meetings and events.

articles.title: PAGE 14 ===
articles.summary: This article appears to be a meeting minutes document from the San Juan Astronomical Association, covering a monthly meeting on August 5, 1968. The discussion includes various astronomy-related topics and upcoming events.

articles.title: PAGE 15 ===
articles.summary: The article discusses two meetings held by a group in August 1968, outlining their decisions and plans for future regular meetings.

articles.title: PAGE 16 ===
articles.summary: The article discusses the International Astronomical Union (IAU) Convention and a preliminary report on the Perseid meteor shower. It also mentions an upcoming star party event in September.

articles.title: PAGE 17 ===
articles.summary: The article is the minutes of a planning meeting for an astronomy club, discussing topics such as eclipse photography, observing methods, and club budget. The meeting decided on the program and schedule for the October meetings, including a star party.

articles.title: PAGE 18 ===
articles.summary: The SJAA regular meeting discussed the possibility of speakers and an observing section period. A questionnaire was also proposed for the October meeting.

articles.title: PAGE 19 ===
articles.summary: The secretary of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers club requests Dr. John G. Phillips to deliver a Morrison Lecture on comets, planets, or deep-space topics at their December meeting.

articles.title: PAGE 20 ===
articles.summary: The article is a letter from the Berkeley Astronomy Department to the San Jose Amateur Astronomers, discussing arrangements for a Morrison Lecture with Dr. R.P. Kraft on December 6, 1968.

articles.title: PAGE 21 ===
articles.summary: A letter from Jeffrey D. Scargle, a junior astronomer at Lick Observatory, accepting an invitation to give a lecture on 'Activity in the Crab Nebula' to the San Jose Amateur Astronomers Society.

articles.title: PAGE 22 ===
articles.summary: A letter from the San Jose Amateur Astronomers to Jeffrey D. Scargle, inviting him to speak at their December meeting about his talk on 'Activity in the Crab Nebula'.

articles.title: PAGE 23 ===
articles.summary: The article appears to be a partial and illegible document, likely a page from a larger report or note. It mentions a request for a specific item (a slide projector) and contains handwritten text that is not legible. The purpose of the document is unclear.

articles.title: PAGE 24 ===
articles.summary: A planning meeting for a group was held on October 18, 1968, where events were planned and discussions took place about the construction of a 12Â½" telescope. The next planning meeting was scheduled for November 15, 1968, at Don Summers' house.

articles.title: PAGE 25 ===
articles.summary: The article mentions an upcoming lecture on the Crab Nebula by Dr. Scargle at Foothill College, as well as a planning meeting for Sunparty on December 20th.
